summary: A peace treaty is a formal  agreement which ends a conflict.
full_text: A peace treaty is an agreement between two or more hostile parties, usually countries or governments, which formally ends a state of war between the parties. It is different from an armistice, which is an agreement to stop hostilities, or a surrender, in which an army agrees to give up arms, or a  in which the parties may agree to temporarily or permanently stop fighting.
title: Peace treaty
